Class Main

java.lang.Object
  Main

public class Main
extends java.lang.Object

Class main contains all the methods necessary to run my simplified version of Conway's Game of Life.

Version:
Version 1, Started on 10/15/2014
Author:
Tushar Iyer

Method Detail

boundsChecker

public static boolean boundsChecker(boolean[][] map,
                                    int x,
                                    int y)
Method boundsChecker is a bounds checking method that makes sure that the program and all its methods remain within the alotted boundaries.

Parameters:
map - A parameter which is the 2D array printed in the console window
x - A parameter which is an int which represents all the cells in the x-plane of the array
y - A parameter which is an int that represents cells when going through the y-plane of the array
Returns:
The return value is a boolean that tells us the following: - Whether or not x is greater or equal to 0 - Whether or not x is smaller than the length of the map (30) - Whether or not y is greater or equal to 0 - Whether or not y is smaller than the map length at index 0

displayGrid

public static void displayGrid(boolean[][] grid)
Method displayGrid looks at each cell and then gives it a dead(.) or alive(*) value

Parameters:
grid - A parameter which is the 2D array on which the program is displayed

generation

public static boolean[][] generation()
Method generation is a method which creates the 2D array

Returns:
The return value is a 2D array called grid

killProgram

public static void killProgram(int until)
Method killProgram is a method that will stop the program after a certain amount of time This method was only created because the program will not end on its own.

main

public static void main()
Method main runs playGame();

message

public static void message()
Method message concatonates several strings and displays it to the user prior to running the program.

neighborCheck

public static boolean neighborCheck(int nosNeighbors,
                                    boolean alive)
Method neighborCheck is a method which selects each cell and goes through several conditions to determine whether or not the cell should be dead or alive in the following generation

Parameters:
nosNeighbors - an integer which holds the number of neighbors for the selected cell
alive - a boolean value which has two states: Alive and Dead
Returns:
The return value is a boolean which decides the outcome of the selected cell in the following generation

neighborCounter

public static int neighborCounter(boolean[][] grid,
                                  int left,
                                  int down)
Method neighborCounter is a method which runs several conditions to count the number of neighbors that exist for the selected cell

Parameters:
grid - A parameter which is the 2D array that we see in the console window
row - A parameter which is an integer that takes us through each row
col - A parameter which is an integer that takes us through each column. This int along with the int row ends up going through each cell in the 30X30 array
Returns:
The return value is an int which contains the number of neighbors. It is then passed on to the method neighborCheck() to continue the process in determining the next generation.

nextGeneration

public static boolean[][] nextGeneration(boolean[][] map)
Method nextGeneration is a method that uses the data collected in neighborCounter, neighborCheck & boundsChecker to create the grid for the next generation

Parameters:
map - A parameter which is a 2D array which encompasses the whole map
Returns:
The return value is the updated grid which will be displayed to the user upon pressing enter

playGame

public static void playGame()
Method playGame runs all the methods and displays the program in the console window
